title: We are truly one nation, under God, indivisible and that we must remain so in the face of any threat to ensure our country remains strong, united and free.
author: Michael Enzi

title: If we can understand that death is not the end but is really a transition into the next life, the great part of life, that frees us up into receiving God's courage and his help.
author: Max Lucado

title: I know God's voice. I've seen God's hand. If the Lord is my helper, why should I be afraid?
author: John Piper

title: God gives talent. Work transforms talent into genius.
author: Anna Pavlova

title: If God is the mystery of the universe, these mysteries, we're tackling these mysteries one by one. If you're going to stay religious at the end of the conversation, God has to mean more to you than just where science has yet to tread.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

title: The 'means of grace' are such as Bible reading, private prayer, and regularly worshiping God in Church, wherein one hears the Word taught and participates in the Lord's Supper. I lay it down as a simple matter of fact that no one who is careless about such things must ever expect to make much progress in sanctification.
author: J. C. Ryle

title: God doesn't want us to have rigid rituals with Him. In the new covenant, He is more interested in having a relationship with us.
author: Joseph Prince

title: I have sinned against You, my Lord, and I would ask that your precious blood would wash and cleanse every stain until it is in the seas of God's forgiveness.
author: Jimmy Swaggart

title: Woman was God's second mistake.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

title: No man is excluded from calling upon God, the gate of salvation is set open unto all men: neither is there any other thing which keepeth us back from entering in, save only our own unbelief.
author: John Calvin

title: I watched the guy that hits a home run, and he comes across the plate and he points skyward, like thanking for the help from the Almighty to hit the home run. And as he does that, I say to myself, 'God screwed the pitcher.' And I don't know how else you look at it.
author: Bobby Knight

title: As a blind man has no idea of colors, so have we no idea of the manner by which the all-wise God perceives and understands all things.
author: Isaac Newton

title: When you focus on how wonderful God is and all the great things He's done... is doing... and even will do in your life, your natural response will be praise, adoration and awe. Don't let yourself ever get used to it... stay amazed!
author: Joyce Meyer

title: Perhaps nothing helps us make the movement from our little selves to a larger world than remembering God in gratitude. Such a perspective puts God in view in all of life, not just in the moments we set aside for worship or spiritual disciplines. Not just in the moments when life seems easy.
author: Henri Nouwen

title: I want clean water and clean air and conservation... that's not what extreme environmentalists are all about. For them, it is a religion. They believe in trees and animals, not God.
author: Roger Ailes

title: I'm a God-fearing man, go to church every Sunday, and have since I was a boy. But if I ever found out that God cared one way or another about a borderline illegal fist-fight on Saturday night, I would be so greatly disappointed that it would make rethink my entire belief system.
author: Chael Sonnen

title: I can't gather around and talk about how much everybody in the room doesn't believe in God. I just don't - I don't have the energy for that, and so I... Agnostic separates me from the conduct of atheists whether or not there is strong overlap between the two categories, and at the end of the day I'd rather not be any category at all.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
tags: Day, Believe, End Of The Day

title: For God so loved the World that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
author: Jesus Christ

title: If God is pleased in making you sick and unhappy, I hate God.
author: Ernestine Rose

title: That which God said to the rose, and caused it to laugh in full-blown beauty, He said to my heart, and made it a hundred times more beautiful.
author: Rumi

title: The divine is God's concern; the human, man's. My concern is neither the divine nor the human, not the true, good, just, free, etc., but solely what is 'mine,' and it is not a general one, but is - 'unique,' as I am unique. Nothing is more to me than myself!
author: Max Stirner

title: God, he deals you blows that at sometimes you think you can't handle and in the last year there have been things that we thought we couldn't handle but we've dealt with it up until this point.
author: Brett Favre

title: There are two kinds of people one can call reasonable: those who serve God with all their heart because they know him, and those who seek him with all their heart because they do not know him.
author: Blaise Pascal

title: If you really want to experience God, go and make disciples.
author: Francis Chan

title: If there is a God, whence proceed so many evils? If there is no God, whence cometh any good?
author: Boethius

title: I partly know why I have not led a perfect life like other believers. But I avow to my Lord, and I do not lie, that from the time when I first knew him, the love of God and the fear of him has grown in me from my youth so that I have, by the power of God, always till now kept the faith.
author: Saint Patrick

title: I believe in believing. My coach John Kavanagh is a big atheist, and he is always trying to persuade people to his way of thinking, and I think, 'What a waste of energy.' If people want to believe in this god or that god, that's fine by me; believe away. But I think we can be our own gods. I believe in myself.
author: Conor McGregor

title: Ministers should not pray so loud, and long, as to exhaust the strength. It is not necessary to weary the throat and lungs in prayer. God's ear is ever open to hear the heart-felt petitions of his humble servants, and he does not require them to wear out the organs of speech in addressing him.
author: Ellen G. White

title: How is it possible that a being with such sensitive jewels as the eyes, such enchanted musical instruments as the ears, and such fabulous arabesque of nerves as the brain can experience itself anything less than a god.
author: Alan Watts

title: We are not weak if we make a proper use of those means which the God of Nature has placed in our power... the battle, sir, is not to the strong alone it is to the vigilant, the active, the brave.
author: Patrick Henry

title: The best place to find God is in a garden. You can dig for him there.
author: George Bernard Shaw

title: If I truly believe everything that's in that book, God is in control. He is in control. He's working for my good. Doesn't mean everything's going to be smooth, but that's all I needed to know. There is a light at the end of the tunnel.
author: Shawn Michaels

title: Thank you, dear God, for this good life and forgive us if we do not love it enough. Thank you for the rain. And for the chance to wake up in three hours and go fishing: I thank you for that now, because I won't feel so thankful then.
author: Garrison Keillor

title: God has never, in the history of mankind, allowed his name to go long offended.
author: David Wilkerson

title: Man was made at the end of the week's work, when God was tired.
author: Mark Twain

title: I used to wonder if it was God's plan that I should be alone for so much of my life. But I found peace. I found happiness within people and the world.
author: Lana Del Rey

title: God tests and proves us by the common occurrences of life. It is the little things which reveal the chapters of the heart.
author: Ellen G. White
